reasoning: CMT2R is a specific autosomal recessive axonal subtype of CMT disease caused by LMNA or other gene mutations. Overall CMT prevalence ~1 per 100k, with type 2 (axonal) forms comprising ~20% of cases. CMT2R appears to be a rare subtype with limited published epidemiological data. Estimate based on proportion of CMT2 disease and clinical series data.
source: Charcot-Marie-Tooth Disease Association; peer-reviewed CMT subtype literature
